Job Title: Safety Specialist

Location: St Joseph, MI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
For over 80 years, LECO has been a leader in the development and production of world class laboratory instruments delivering state of the art products nationwide and across the globe. Located in St. Joseph, Michigan, LECO continues to be a family-owned company that understands the value of shared interests, long-term stability, loyalty, and trust.

Schedule

Full Time: 8:00am – 5:00pm, Monday – Friday.

Position Summary

The Safety Specialist will be responsible for ensuring the safety of all LECO employees, visitors, and guests, as well as ensuring that manufacturing operations are done in a safe manner.

Position Responsibilities

 Help ensure the safety of all LECO employees, visitors, and guests  Constantly monitor OSHA and MIOSHA (and other agencies) for new safety regulations and/or updates to existing safety regulations  Conduct new employee training classes for all new hires (and refresher training for current employees)  Conduct hazard-specific training classes  Develop and maintain training records for all employees  Conduct/coordinate air quality monitoring and noise level measurements in various departments  Coordinate annual respirator fit testing  Perform Safety Audits of all LECO facilities  Author and maintain various corporate written programs and policies (such as Machine Guarding, Lockout/Tagout, Emergency Response Plan, etc.)  Develop and maintain a Job Safety Analysis (JSA) for all job titles within the company  Investigate all workplace accidents and take/recommend corrective actions  Electronically file OSHA 300 Logs annually and post 300A summaries at all facilities  Investigate all chemical spills and take/recommend corrective actions  Recommend, purchase, and maintain inventory of personal protective equipment (PPE)  Serve on the Safety Council and other safety committees  Maintain Safety Data Sheet (SDS) binders for hazardous in-house chemicals at various facilities  Perform other duties as required 

Position Requirements

 Strong knowledge of OSHA regulations (MIOSHA, general industry preferred)  Familiarity with HAZMAT, ANSI, NFPA  Familiarity with AED/CPR/First-Aid (preferred)  Ability to interact and work with various departments  Strong problem-solving skills  Familiarity with Microsoft Office applications  Familiarity with Enterprise Resource Planning software (Oracle preferred)  Ability to work independently and in a group environment  Ability to travel to different local LECO facilities 

Education/Certifications

 Associate of Science in Occupational Safety and Health (preferred)  OSHA/MIOSHA 30-Hour certificate in general industry (preferred) 

 EOE M/F/VET/Disability

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
